:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/respopagesextod2023.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 100928 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (5): PA, SZ, AG, Sex, TOD
dbl (2): Pop, Time

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup()%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=AG, 
              values_from=POP) %>%
  mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])
         +rowSums(.[14])) %>%
mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:13]) # Aged 25 - 59
         + rowSums(.[15])) %>% # Aged 60 - 64
  mutate(`AGED` = rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
  mutate(`TOTAL` = rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%
  mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`) 
          / `ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
  select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`,
         `ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`,
         `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ),
            .funs = list(toupper)) %>%
  filter(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` > 0)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz_pop2023 <- left_join(mpsz19_shp, popdata2023,
                          by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
write_rds(mpsz_pop2023, "data/mpszpop2023.rds")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
tmap mode set to plotting
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qtm(mpsz_pop2023, 
    fill = "DEPENDENCY")
```
